description: From Hebrew מַצָּה‎ (matsá). The spelling 'matzo' is a back-formation of matzos, which is borrowed from מצות.

nouns.description: matzo (countable and uncountable, plural matzos or matzot or matzoth)

entries.meaning: (uncountable) Thin, unleavened bread in Jewish cuisine.
examples: Matzo is eaten by Jews on Passover.

entries.meaning: (countable) A piece of the above bread.
